introduction: The following passage is adapted from The Lost Patron by Elias J. Carr (2022).
text: Lady Bronwellâ€™s estate has long been famous for its vibrant gardens, but a recent drought has left them struggling to survive. Only her steadfast gardener, who ______ tirelessly each morning, has prevented the complete demise of the plants.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Pay attention to pronoun-antecedent agreement and verb form consistency.
explanation: Choice B is correct because the singular subject gardener takes the singular present tense verb waters, which also matches the ongoing nature of the activity. A were watering incorrectly uses a plural verb. C water is a plural verb form. D was watering implies a past progressive action rather than a continuous present action.
